body: Alternative solution: inside `assertAll()`, make sure the stream is `.sequential()`.
@jbduncan : In my case i'd like to execute the stream in parallel for performance reasons.

Ah okay, thanks for explaining @flowerrrr. However, that leaves me with a few questions:

1. Are you at liberty to explain to us why you're trying to improve the performance this way, or otherwise what your use case is?
2. I wonder, wouldn't using a synchronized list cause the potential performance benefit of using a parallel stream to disappear due to the locking involved?
3. AFAICT, if you pass in a parallel stream of executables, then the order of those executables would be non-deterministic. Would this non-determinism be okay for you? Or an I missing something here?

@jbduncan: 
1. Test was written before the new parallel test support of junit 5 was released. So i thought using AssertAll gives me a handy way to run my tests in parallel.
2. The performance impact is virtually zero as only in case of an assertion error an element is added to the synchronized list of failures. 
3. Non-deterministic is ok.

If an API supports streams it should also work if used with parallel streams - or, if for some reason it does not support parallel streams, it should be stated in the documentation of the API.
@flowerrrr I pushed a fix to `master`. Please try out the latest `5.4.0-SNAPSHOT` (using [Sonatype's snapshot repo](https://oss.sonatype.org/content/repositories/snapshots/)).

issue.title: Release JUnit 5.3.2

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
## Overview

List of fixed bugs since release 5.3.1 so far: https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue+label%3A%22type%3A+bug%22+milestone%3A%225.4+M1%22+

## Deliverables

- [x] Create 5.3.2 Milestone on GitHub.
- [x] Move bug fix issues to 5.3.2 Milestone.
- [x] Backport bug fixes to `5.3.x` branch.
   - [x] #1591
   - [x] #1600
   - [x] #1603
   - [x] #1640
   - [x] #1643
   - [x] #1646
   - [x] #1665
   - [x] #1666
- [x] Create `release-notes-5.3.2.adoc` based on entries in `release-notes-5.4.0-M1.adoc`.
- [x] Copy release note _polishing_ from `release-notes-5.4.0-M1.adoc` on `master` into `release-notes-5.3.2.adoc`.
- [x] Ensure that #1600 is documented in `release-notes-5.3.2.adoc`.
- [x] Copy `release-notes-5.3.2.adoc` to `master`.
- [x] Delete `release-notes-5.4.0-M1.adoc` from the `5.3.x` branch.
- [x] Update `@since` and `@API` entries for backported bug fixes in `5.3.x` branch.
- [x] Cherry pick updated `@since` and `@API` entries for backported bug fixes to `master` branch.
- [x] Update Release Notes on `master`.
- [x] Have at least one more set of eyes review the backported commits.
- [x] Ensure the Travis CI builds pass.
- [ ] Release Jupiter and Vintage 5.3.2 as well as Platform 1.3.2 according to the [Releasing Checklist](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/wiki/Releasing).
